etymology.description: 参(參) (cān, "participate") + 观(觀) (guān, "observe") = to visit
etymology.interpretation: 参观(參觀) (cānguān, "to visit") combines the idea of participation with observing. When you visit a place such as a museum or exhibition, you partake in the act of experiencing the environment while taking in its features and details through observation.

examples.chinese: 我们参观了博物馆(我們參觀了博物館)。
他明天参观展览(他明天參觀展覽)，然后去咖啡馆(然後去咖啡館)。
examples.pinyin: Tā míngtiān cānguān zhǎnlǎn, ránhòu qù kāfēiguǎn.
examples.english: He will visit the exhibition tomorrow, then go to the coffee shop.
